meanings.definition: The act of moving in a circular or curving path.
meanings.sent1: The children enjoyed watching the wheelings of the carousel.
meanings.sent2: The car made smooth wheelings around the bend.
meanings.sent3: The wheelings of the toy train always made the toddler giggle.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's graceful wheelings across the stage mesmerized the audience.
meanings.sent5: The wheelings of the Ferris wheel against the sunset created a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: The act of spinning or rotating.
meanings.sent1: The wheelings of the pinwheel in the wind fascinated the child.
meanings.sent2: The wheelings of the fan cooled the room quickly.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected wheelings of the spinning top surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The wheelings of the windmill generated electricity for the farm.
meanings.sent5: The wheelings of the propeller helped the plane take off smoothly.

meanings.definition: The act of conveying or transporting something on wheels.
meanings.sent1: The delivery truck's wheelings brought packages to our doorstep.
meanings.sent2: The wheelings of the luggage cart made it easy to transport bags at the airport.
meanings.sent3: The wheelings of the shopping cart were a bit wobbly on the uneven floor.
meanings.sent4: The wheelings of the wheelchair allowed the patient to move around independently.
meanings.sent5: The wheelings of the skateboarder down the ramp were fast and thrilling.
